New Records: The Pirates suffered their biggest blown lead since 2011.
Key Match Events: The Pirates blew a seven-run lead in the final three innings, losing to the Cubs 14-10.
Christian Bethancourt lined an 0-1 fastball that shortstop Isiah Kiner-Falefa could only get a piece of before it trickled into left field to put Chicago ahead, 11-10.
David Bednar entered the ninth with a two-run lead but allowed one run and loaded the bases before the Cubs took the lead.
Paul Skenes allowed three runs (two earned) with six strikeouts over five solid innings.
Bryan Reynolds went 3-for-5 with a homer.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Derek Shelton expressed frustration, stating, 'I don't know if I've been as pissed as I am right now.'
Shelton commented on the need for better execution, 'We've got to execute. We're not executing. If you don't execute at the end of games, you don't win games.'
Paul Skenes emphasized the importance of playing for each other and getting back to the team's identity.
Bryan Reynolds stressed the need to stick together as a team and support each other.
Connor Joe mentioned the importance of sticking together as a team and playing for each other.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The loss was David Bednar’s sixth blown save of the season, ballooning his ERA to 6.32 over 50 outings.
August has been a grueling month for the Pirates, with the team losing by one run eight times and blowing a league-high seven saves.
